channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole around metal road fixture, 13th September
item.description:
Really scary hole in the street, particularly for cyclists who would likely be thrown off their bicycle if they hit the metal corner. Also dangerous for cyclists trying to avoid the hole / metal corners.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 193, Fleet Street, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Beginning of Nelson Close to the left, 13th September
item.description:
The street light in that bend has been off for few weeks and as it's a bend it's dangerous for drivers as well as pedestrians not seeing hazards
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Nelson Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken bins, rubbish spread into street, 13th September
item.description:
I am not resident here, but 8-13 Poolman Street apartment block and the apartment block opposite side of the road on the Poolmans Street/Marlow Way junction have several. wheelie bins with no lids or broken lids. As a result, foxes and wind are spreading domestic waste into the street every week massively increasing levels of litter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marlow Way, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 13th September
item.description:
Dumped rubbish for several weeks. Appears to be domestic rubbish and mdf type furniture like cupboards.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5-6, Chargrove Close, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 13th September
item.description:

item.title: Food waste and plastics in street, 13th September
item.description:
Bins are constantly overflowing and open and then the rubbish is taken and spread into the street by foxes and other pets who pull the bags open (or the rubbish is blown by the wind). It is creating a risk of rats.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5-6, Chargrove Close, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Communal waste and litter on Mandela way road and pavement, 12th September
item.description:
There are two large communal waste bins on the pavement on Mandela way. There are also rubbish bags and litter on the road which is obstructing cars. These bins have been there over two weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mandela Way, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped a load of black bags under the trees outside NIMEGEN WAY, 12th September
item.description:
Constant flytipping in NIMEGEN WAY,every week,ongoing problem.The Council is doing nothing to solve this problem
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Nimegen Way, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter on Tabard street near rental bikes, 12th September
item.description:
There is plastic bottles, fast food packaging and leaves on road and pavement on Tabard Street near Dorking House.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 217, Tabard Street, The Borough, London

item.title: Bad road rattles my property, 12th September
item.description:
All day and night until the last bus runs, my house rattles to the bus schedule so every 10 mins all day, going both ways .have been reporting this for two years yet nothing done, Westwood lane has had new surface and not hook lane. Please take a look and don’t close the case again without looking into it. We all pay our taxes. This is keeping us up at night . The vibrations rattle glasses in the kitchen cuboard at the back of the house
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Graffiti on Junction Box, 147 Kilburn Lane, located in Allington Road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Allington Road, London

item.title: Broken streetlight on Camden Row, 12th September
item.description:
The streetlight half way up Camden Row is broken.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Camden Row, Blackheath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Messy road, 12th September
item.description:
The close is covered with overgrown trees and bushes. The road is full of leaves berries (very slippery) and twigs. Half the road is unpassable by car and getting worse. We would appreciate it very much if the bushes could be cut and the road and curb-side could be cleaned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tresco Close, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illuminated roundabout sign damaged., 12th September
item.description:
Illuminated roundabout sign damaged at the Bridge Road / Coper Cope Road roundabout, when coming from Bridge Road onto the roundabout. Electric installation exposed - risk of electric shock.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bridge Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Miscellaneous rubbish, 12th September
item.description:
Rubbish left on pavement for approx one week

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Byne Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gutter, 12th September
item.description:
Entering Cray Valley Road from Poverest Road the gutter on the right hand side it full of weeds and rubbish thrown from cars. The growth of weeds is stopping the rain water from flowing causing flooding into driveways of Barmouth.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cray Valley Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown weeds, 12th September
item.description:
Over grown weeds in and around car park on Braganza street. It’s like a jungle, the weeds are growing that high they look like they are going to grow into the cars. The pavement can barely be seen and rubbish is being dumped. This is the 3 rd time this has been reported and nothing has been done!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Braganza Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet
